name: Bootstrap Buttons
author: David Cramer

sections.description:
A WordPress plugin that allows you to use Twitters Bootstrap buttons in your content.

The plugin offers 4 buttons sizes (Large, Small and Mini), 7 Button styles/colors (Default, Primary, Info, Success, Warning, Danger and Inverse) and 140 Icons in both Black and White versions.

Includes a shortcode inserter to make inserting your buttons hassle free in both the visual and html editor.

Built using Caldera Engine, the Pro version of My Shortcodes and exported as a WordPress Plugin.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin folder ‘bootstrap-buttons’ to your /wp-content/plugins/ folder
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. A Bootstrap Buttons button will be available above the Content Editor.
sections.faq:
Q: Are there any FAQ’s?
A: No

Q: This has been up for over a year. Have you ever been given a donation?
A: No
sections.changelog:
1.1

  • Fixed a bug that caused “this page” to fail

1.1

  • Updated for Bootstrap 2.3.2
  • Updated for WordPress 3.5.2
  • Added in visual icon selector
  • Added a Flat theme
  • Added a Block size for full width buttons
  • Added dropdown buttons for multiple links (Block size not supported)
  • Added split buttons for a primary link and a dropdown form addtional links (Block size not supported)

1.0

  • initial release
